summary: Medicaid spending is projected to hit $1 trillion by 2026. Studies have found a small percentage of beneficiaries account for a large amount of its spending. Many high-cost beneficiaries have poorly managed chronic conditions that can result in costly services—such as emergency room visits—that are preventable. We asked officials in 7 states what they do to manage health care costs and improve care for high-cost...
title: Medicaid: Efforts to Identify, Predict, or Manage High-Expenditure Beneficiaries
